Expectation1: Fix bugs and troubleshoot issues reported by users or QA
Situation1: A minor UI glitch occasionally shows up but has an easy workaround
Expectation2: Organize and lead religious education classes for children and adults
Situation2: The regular weekly religious education class for the parish's children is scheduled.
Story: I stared at the bug report blinking on my screen, the subject line marked “URGENT” by QA. It was just a minor UI glitch—nothing catastrophic, and users could easily work around it. Still, the expectation was clear: fix it now, before the next release. My phone buzzed with a reminder: the children’s religious education class was starting in thirty minutes. I was supposed to be there early, to set up the room and greet the families. The parish counted on me to guide their children, to be present and attentive, not distracted by work. But my team was counting on me too, and I could already imagine the messages piling up if I left this bug unresolved. My mind raced, torn between the code on my screen and the lesson plan in my bag. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in, each demanding my full attention, each unwilling to wait.
